issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: Currently we do not log our decisions with respect to llap. Are we running everything in llap mode or only parts of the plan. We need more logging. Also, if llap mode is all but for some reason, we cannot run the work in llap mode, fail and throw an exception advise the user to change the mode to auto.
fields.summary: Improve logging in llap decider and throw exception in case llap mode is all but we cannot run in llap.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12795081 - PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build

[~sseth] Yes. The other log lines should tell us which operator interferes with running in llap. I changed the exception to use the right configuration variable from HiveConf. However, there is currently no way to get the values a configuration can take from code.

I think it is better to not add more configuration to enable/disable the mode = all behavior. If the user is not sure if they can run in llap, they need to use mode = auto. The mode = all behavior only prevents further checking on the query if it can be run in llap. If under mode all, query cannot be run in llap because some parts of the plan cannot be run in it, it makes sense to stop the user from proceeding. If you feel strongly about needing the flag, I can add one but I am not convinced at this point in time.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12798605 - PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build
Ping [~sershe]. Can you take a look as well please.

I don't think we need to log each time we look at an operator or vertex. At least not on info level. That will be too noisy. But we should add logging each place in the code where we decide LLAP isn't an option. And then with a reason (which I think is missing in this patch still).
The new logs captured which operator failed/passed the check. I modified it so that the log is printed only in case of failure.
